data.name: Tic-Tac-Toe  Winning Possibilites
data.description:
In this kata you will create ```win_counts(board,mark)``` which receives a 9 length list of strings with possible values: ```'','X','O'``` and a mark that could be ```'X'``` or ```'O'```. The elements display respect the following index order:

```
 0 | 1 | 2     
---+---+---       
 3 | 4 | 5    
---+---+---     
 6 | 7 | 8
```

The main goal is to see if the mark given has any possibilities of winning based on the free spaces. The function should return the number of winning possibilities of that mark. 

First example:
```
   |   |      
---+---+---       
   |   |      
---+---+---     
   |   |  
```
In an empty board, both marks have ```8``` possibilities of winning, 3 rows, 3 columns, 2 diagonals.
```
 X |   |      
---+---+---       
   |   |      
---+---+---     
   |   |  
```
After the first play, ```'X'``` keeps ```8``` possibilities while ```'O'```lost 1 row, 1 column and 1 diagonal so it is left with ```5```.

Second Example:
```
 O | O |      
---+---+---       
 X |   |      
---+---+---     
   | X | X
```
In this case, since ```'O'``` has one less mark than ```'X'```we know that it is his turn and he would probably win. However, since we are only looking for the empty spaces, in this board, we are considering ```4``` winning possibilities for ```'X'``` and ```2``` for ```'O'```.

Important!

Tic Tac Toe is a game where each player plays alternatively and ends when there is a winner or a draw. Thus, there are some combinations that would not be valid in a board. For example:

```
   |   |           X | O | X
---+---+---       ---+---+---  
   | O |     and   X | O | X
---+---+---       ---+---+--- 
 O |   |           X | O | O
``` 

In this cases the function must return the value ```-1```.

Any valid finished game should return ```'0'``` for both marks since there is no more possibilities. The result of the game is already known.

Don't forget to rate the kata :)
